children.content: Follow the big news from Germany, discover off-beat news from Berlin and other cities. Read in-depth features that help you understand how Germans think.

children.alt: Colorful condoms are illuminated on a table
children.title: Colorful condoms are illuminated on a table

children.text: Germany: Woman sentenced for poking holes in partner's condoms
In what the judge described as a "historic" case, a woman has been found guilty of sexual assault after poking holes in her partner's condoms without his knowledge or consent.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.text: Scholz stands firm on Ukraine visit amid criticism at home and abroad

children.alt: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz speaking at Meseberg Palace outside Berlin
children.title: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz speaking at Meseberg Palace outside Berlin

children.text: Chancellor Olaf Scholz addressed Ukraine's refusal to welcome President Frank-Walter Steinmeier again Wednesday, calling it "a problem for the German people." He said Kyiv needed to do its part to resolve the issue.

children.alt: A refugee family after landing in Hannover
children.title: A refugee family after landing in Hannover

children.text: Germany: Over 1 in 4 people have 'migrant background'
The number of people with "migrant background" â€” foreigners and people with foreign roots â€” keeps rising in Germany, with Turkey, Poland and Russia the top three countries of familial origin.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.text: Germany warns prices may spike as Russia sanctions tighten

children.alt: Click here to watch live
children.title: Click here to watch live

children.text: Germany's Cabinet has wrapped two days and talks about the war in Ukraine and its impact on the German economy. The government warned that a planned EU oil embargo could cause supply problems and even higher inflation.

children.alt: soldiers and armored vehicles during Allied Spirit 2022 exercise in Hohenfels
children.title: soldiers and armored vehicles during Allied Spirit 2022 exercise in Hohenfels

children.text: Ukrainian troops get training in Germany
Ukrainian soldiers are receiving weapons training on military bases in Germany. Does that make Germany a party to war?

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.text: Germans split over heavy weapons deliveries to Ukraine

children.alt: A Gepard tank moves across a field
children.title: A Gepard tank moves across a field

children.text: The German public is divided on the issue of military support for Ukraine. Many fear the delivery of tanks and training of Ukrainian soldiers in Germany may drag the country into the war.
Open letter about weapons deliveries to Ukraine draws criticism

children.alt: Alice Schwarzer smiling into the camera.
children.title: Alice Schwarzer smiling into the camera.

children.text: The publication of an open letter to German Chancellor Scholz signed by leading cultural figures has triggered a fierce debate about the planned delivery of heavy weapons to Ukraine â€” especially on social media.

children.alt: PCK Schwedt refinery in eastern Germany, seen at night
children.title: PCK Schwedt refinery in eastern Germany, seen at night

children.text: German oil refinery fears EU embargo
As EU member states push for a Russian oil embargo, the Schwedt refinery in eastern Germany faces an uncertain future.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.value: German parliament votes to send heavy weapons to Ukraine

children.alt: Germany to send weapons to Ukraine
children.title: Germany to send weapons to Ukraine

children.text: Germany to send weapons to Ukraine
Germanyâ€™s parliament has voted overwhelmingly in favor of delivering heavy weapons to Ukraine.

children.title: 'Welcome class': Ukrainian students attend German schoolsÂ

children.text: 'Welcome class': Ukrainian students attend German schoolsÂ
Schools in Germany are setting up special classes to cater for young Ukrainians who have fled war.

children.value: Germany outlaws use of letter 'Z' in support of war of aggression

children.alt: Germany bans letter 'Z' to support invasion
children.title: Germany bans letter 'Z' to support invasion

children.text: Germany bans letter 'Z' to support invasion
The letter "Z" has come to symbolize support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

children.title: Kyiv Symphony Orchestra on tour in Germany

children.text: Kyiv Symphony Orchestra on tour in Germany
The orchestra hopes to raise awareness of Ukraine's culture and win more support for the war effort.

children.alt: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, paper in hand, walks as a German flag hangs in the foreground
children.title: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, paper in hand, walks as a German flag hangs in the foreground

children.text: Opinion: Germany, scapegoat of the Ukraine war
Germany is being criticized by Ukraine and other countries in Europe, but that is unfair says DW's Marco MÃ¼ller, because Germany is doing more to help Kyiv than almost any other country.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.alt: Thema Kriegskinder l Frau Handt am Computer
children.title: Thema Kriegskinder l Frau Handt am Computer

children.text: Ukraine war makes German seniors relive their WWII trauma
For many Germans old enough to remember, the images of destruction, death and flight in Ukraine trigger memories of their own experiences during World War II.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.alt: A German flag is raised in front of the German parliament in Berlin
children.title: A German flag is raised in front of the German parliament in Berlin

children.text: The story of Germany's national anthem
Created in the 19th century, the "Deutschlandlied" was sullied by the Nazis. Germany decided 70 years ago it would adopt only the third verse of the original song as its national anthem.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.alt: A close-up of flames.
children.title: A close-up of flames.

children.text: How the German language plays with fire
Discover German expressions with "fire": Find out why someone would put their hand in a fire for someone, or why you'd want to light up someone's bottom.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.alt: A villa in Berlin, the historical site of the Wannsee Konferenz, lies at the end of a pathway
children.title: A villa in Berlin, the historical site of the Wannsee Konferenz, lies at the end of a pathway

children.text: Germany: Where the Holocaust was conceived

On January 20, 1942, senior Nazi officials met at a Berlin villa to discuss the "final solution" to "the Jewish question." Deportations to ghettos and concentration camps had already begun, but the Wannsee Conference coordinated plans for the systematic murder of European Jews.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.alt: Berlin Vorher-Nachher Bildergalerie 30 Jahre Wiedervereinigung
children.title: Berlin Vorher-Nachher Bildergalerie 30 Jahre Wiedervereinigung

children.text: Germany was divided for years, and much has changed since reunification. Here are some of the biggest changes in pictures from Berlin, Potsdam, Stralsund and other places that have witnessed a remarkable transformation.

children.comment: / M-Teaser below

children.alt: Retirement home for animals
children.title: Retirement home for animals

children.text: Germany's North Sea coast is home to the first retirement home for dairy cattle.
